overview:
Scott Unkefer is an IT consultant. He entered Netscape out of College as a technical support engineer. Quickly became senior Solaris Server Support Engineer for the LDAP, Mail, Calendar, and Webmail server products. Also Scott was assign Head of Engineering and QA liasons for Mail and Webmail. Held major accounts including Safeway, United Nations, NASA, Bank of America, others.

After almost 2 years he founded WebFS, Inc where he dealed with Multi Platform (unix, linux, windows) distributed file system software product with beta customers including Intel, CERN, PMC-Sierra, Lehman Brothers, and Morgan Stanley and also wrote (and holds) two patents including the File System File Transfer Protocol and File and byte-range caching and locking in a multi-node distributed system.

He currently is the President of SourceSouth, a company that specializes in Software Product Development: Design, Development, and Project Management for Web Sites, Web Applications, and Software Products.
